text:
Hi <!here|@here> 
I have this web developed in HubSpot <http://www.theniu.com/>
But the slider, based in Bootstrap3 is not working correctly in SAFARI browser. 
Each transition of the images shows this annoying white background effect instead of showing one image after the other. It isn´t happening in the rest of the browsers. 
We have tried to create a basic bootstrap3 slider on HubSpot and the problem is the same. 
Any ideas about what the problem could be?
<@U39U75WDS>  can you post a screenshot of the white background effect? I'm not seeing it

we have a potential client who is looking to migrate over to HubSpot. They are thinking of going with HS to do the migration. Does anyone know if HS creates a template per page when they do the migration or do they build a template for multi-page use?

I have some details on how the migration process goes (from what is on the HS site) but there is no detailed info on what they do in the migration (like using HubL for things or if they style their basic components)
They dont create templates per page. They try to group the pages. They create some custom modules, they create some stuff in the template. All of it uses the COS.
Some of the migrators are better than others
I've looked at some of the migrations and been so frustrated with how it turns out, but I understand at $25 per page over teh first 50, they are getting a good deal

thats the thing, the price point is nice for them (its ow first 60 pages are free) but I want to make sure for them that they wont be spending more to fix what is done as opposed to just having us do it from the start

be careful of HS migration 
If you have COS skills you should migrate it
because HS migration is not really optimized they just do the same as the original theme
the vast theme?
no, their site ---
like original site
ah i see
code isnt though out and optimized
thought
i agree with <@U25PYL3Q8>  :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U39U75WDS|nerea> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nerea/F6BN2T0ES/vid-20170719-wa0002.mp4|VID-20170719-WA0002.mp4>
<@U25PYL3Q8> this is the effect
I also spend time QAing the migration
it may not be of value to your client
thats the thing, i dont think it is when i see what they have and what they will be getting

Personally if they have shit for content and the pages are of no value , in my opinion I'd redirect to a few quality pages and go from there. I don't think most of the stuff people have on their site is of any value
yea the price is great, but i feel like its alot of updating to fix the issues in the end to make it work like their site
for a client I completely redesign theme after HS migration :disappointed:
I dont like the direction of having HubSpot migrate sites. we end up doing new designs anyways
<@U3TR96G84> this is what i have seen
I think it keeps overhead low and prices down. and i understand that is why its used wherre I work
@nera does it only happen on mobile?
actually only in Iphone and in Safari browser in the computer
I'm going to say that it has something to do with the slider code not overriding an active class in bootstrap
you would need to load the slider css after the bootstrap
or you might have to go in and manually add some styles to override it in your page and add !important
I'd also look into any bugs/compatibility issues with ios/safari/webkit with any transitions or other style elements that are being used on the slider.
I have a super busy day but if you are still having the issue later on after looking into those items I can try to help you out!
I had seen that there was a problem with the active class. I am going to try it to fix it. I´ll contact you later if I don´t. Thanks for your help! I really appreciate it!

Not a problem. When you said bootstrap I didnt' think of it but after looking at it, I'm going to bet that is the issue. I am sure if you look at bootstrap code for active, figure out a way to override it on your page and you should be good. I looked into some of the css3 items and they all seem to work and wouldn't really cause that effect.
Hey <@U6AEA3EV6>! Nice to see you in here!
:snowman_without_snow:
Hi Nick :slightly_smiling_face:
Thats what this slack channel was without you -- a snowman without snow lol
lol
